item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 20, 2025 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. It's time to make computing personal again (140 points | 37 comments)
2. TikTok says it is restoring service for U.S. users (483 points | 1472 comments)
3. Chopstick Sleeves as Emissaries of Japanese Typography and Culture (30 points | 1 comment)
4. OpenAI funded FrontierMath Benchmarks and had access to the set (137 points | 33 comments)
5. Hacking the Yamaha DX9 to Turn It into a DX7 (2023) (37 points | 5 comments)
6. Ancient Phoenician Shipwreck Recovered, Sank 2.6k Years Ago Off Coast of Spain (105 points | 28 comments)
7. How do interruptions impact different software engineering activities (15 points | 1 comment)
8. All Lisp indentation schemes are ugly (37 points | 14 comments)
9. Using your Apple device as an access card in unsupported systems (152 points | 49 comments)
10. JTAG 'Hacking' the Original Xbox in 2023 (10 points | 1 comment)
11. The surprising struggle to get a Unix Epoch time from a UTC string in C or C++ (83 points | 37 comments)
12. Physicists have shown that an idealized form of magnetism is heatproof (45 points | 5 comments)
13. Invisible Epidemic: The Loneliness Epidemic (15 points | 3 comments)
14. Build a tiny CA for your homelab with a Raspberry Pi (122 points | 29 comments)
15. The Fuzzing Book (161 points | 5 comments)
16. Why is Git Autocorrect too fast for Formula One drivers? (166 points | 100 comments)
17. Build a Database in 3000 Lines with 0 Dependencies (303 points | 31 comments)
18. Why Twitter is such a big deal (2009) (35 points | 55 comments)
19. UK's elite hardware talent is being wasted (61 points | 69 comments)
20. Escape the walled garden and algorithm black boxes with RSS feeds (221 points | 79 comments)
21. A generative model for inorganic materials design (30 points | 3 comments)
22. GauntletAI (YC S17) will fly you out, train you to build w AI, give you 200k job ( | hide)
23. Staffers unload on Amazon 'leadership' after return-to-office for desk shortage (39 points | 10 comments)
24. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (339 points | 245 comments)
25. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (223 points | 167 comments)
26. Please don't force dark mode (197 points | 173 comments)
27. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (157 points | 56 comments)
28. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (321 points | 188 comments)
29. IsMyXFeedFucked – Analyze How Your X Feed's Impacting You (95 points | 128 comments)
30. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (80 points | 31 comments)
